abstract: Justice Anthony M Kennedy orders Hawaii officials not to count votes in election to choose delegates to convention on self-governance by native Hawaiians; order comes in response to complaints that election, in inviting only votes of native Hawaiians, violates 15th Amendment, barring racial discrimination in voting; while Kennedy acted on his own, full court could consider matter.
lead_paragraph: Justice Anthony M. Kennedy ordered officials not to tally votes or name winners until the full court can rule on the election, which opponents say is discriminatory.

headline.main: Supreme Court Justice Intervenes in Native Hawaiian Election
headline.print_headline: Justice Acts to Delay Vote Result in Hawaii

snippet: Justice Anthony M. Kennedy ordered officials not to tally votes or name winners until the full court can rule on the election, which opponents say is discriminatory.
